suite.name: Test-API-TC-020

kw.name: Open API
kw.doc: Open the web browser passed as argument (default browser is chrome) and open the API page

kw.name: Run Keyword
kw.doc: Executes the given keyword with the given arguments.

kw.name: Evaluate
kw.doc: Evaluates the given expression in Python and returns the result.

kw.name: Call Method
kw.doc: Calls the named method of the given object with the provided arguments.

kw.doc: Calls the named method of the given object with the provided arguments.

kw.doc: Calls the named method of the given object with the provided arguments.

kw.doc: Calls the named method of the given object with the provided arguments.

kw.name: Call Method
kw.doc: Calls the named method of the given object with the provided arguments.

kw.name: Log
kw.doc: Logs the given message with the given level.

kw.name: Create Webdriver
kw.doc: Creates an instance of Selenium WebDriver.
kw.msg: Creating an instance of the Chrome WebDriver.

kw.name: Set Window Size
kw.doc: Sets current windows size to given ``width`` and ``height``.

kw.name: Go To
kw.doc: Navigates the current browser window to the provided ``url``.

kw.name: Capture Page Screenshot
kw.doc: Takes a screenshot of the current page and embeds it into a log file.

kw.name: Create Session
kw.doc: Create Session: create a HTTP session to a server
kw.msg: Creating Session using : alias=API_testing, url=http://localhost:5000/, headers={}, cookies={}, auth=None, timeout=None, proxies=None, verify=False, debug=0

kw.name: Run Keyword And Return Status
kw.doc: Runs the given keyword with given arguments and returns the status as a Boolean value.

kw.name: GET On Session
kw.doc: Sends a GET request on a previously created HTTP Session.
kw.msg: GET Request : url=http://localhost:5000/retrieve-image path_url=/retrieve-image headers={'User-Agent': 'python-requests/2.27.1', 'Accept-Encoding': 'gzip, deflate', 'Accept': '*/*', 'Connection': 'keep-alive'} body=None

GET Response : url=http://localhost:5000/retrieve-image status=400, reason=BAD REQUEST headers={'Server': 'Werkzeug/2.2.2 Python/3.9.19', 'Date': 'Fri, 07 Jun 2024 14:25:13 GMT', 'Content-Type': 'application/json', 'Content-Length': '25', 'Access-Control-Allow-Origin': '*', 'Connection': 'close'} body="Cannot get latest time"
HTTPError: 400 Client Error: BAD REQUEST for url: http://localhost:5000/retrieve-image

kw.name: Should Be Equal
kw.doc: Fails if the given objects are unequal.

test.doc: Test that retrieve-image fails when a layer is not specified. The following steps are executed: - Open the API page - Call retrieve-image endpoint without required parameters - Verify if response code is 400

suite.doc: This test verifies that if not include the parameters of the API functions retrieve a 400 response
